data.title: Add bindings in the options menu for switching weapons, and added map na...
data.body: ...ming for gamepad buttons into optionsDlg.cs

data.title: Remove unused and (partially) unworking UnifiedShell.
data.body: The alternative "UnifiedShell" GUI system is unused and partially unworking:  character and weapon selection will not work without additional configuration.

data.title: Tools GuiProfile Separation.
data.body: This effectively duplicates (where necessary) and moves tools specific GuiProfiles out of the core and into the tools.  This will allow future modifications to either the game guis or tools guis that use these profiles to not conflict with each other.

data.title: Zoom speed issue, with fix
data.body:
Issue with possible fix from the forums:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/133490

data.title: ShapeEditor - Crash on loading model
data.body:
I get a crash that will happen when I load a model into the shape editor, but it doesn't always happen. When it does though it seems to happen every time. If I delete my preferences (start with a fresh build and no settings saved after launching it).

I tracked it down to line 352: Resource<TSShape> model = ResourceManager::get().load( modelName ); in guiShapeEdPreview.cpp

When the crash happens it is inside Vector<LightInfo *>::clear, but when looking at the callstack it is in assembly so not sure what is happening, but I am guessing it is a light in a dts or something? I don't have any inside the dts.

I will add comments as I figure out more about it. If it is model or dts specific I may have to try and make one that I can upload here. The one that I am loading and may be causing it may be confidential.

data.title: Update TinyXML to v2.6.2

data.title: improve render engine
data.body: Hello I been using Torque for a while as the engine seems very outdated and now its open source will help improve the engine in time but I was thinking either doing this myself that we could replace the whole opengl system for ogre3d not that this will help for better down the road but also support ogre plugins

data.title: Fix crash caused by type clash in missing/unavailable/warning texture paths
data.body: Recent change to remove hard coded texture paths caused 'const char *' to be cast to 'String *' causing crash.

data.title: ShapeEditor - Import Shape into, chaning node, and saving
data.body:
If use the Import Shape into feature, use the current detail level and then change the Object Node and click the save. It saves out everything except the Object Node change.

It just needs to save out a line saying %this.setObjectNode i the onLoad function.

I am going to look into trying to fix it, but figured I would post here first in case it can quickly be fixed by someone who has already messed with the code.

data.title: Updating libpng to v1.5.14 and zlib to v1.2.7
data.body: Since libpng has a dependency upon zlib, both updates were combined for one commit/pull-request.

data.title: Blinn/Phong Fix
data.body:
Replaces default Blinn/Phong material mapping in stock Torque 3D. Allows
the developer finer control over specular and detail.

data.title: Removed hard coded directory paths
data.body:
- Removed references to core directory.
- Switch some references to tools directory
- Added preferences variables where appropriate

data.title: Blinn/Phong Replacement-RK
data.body:
Replaces default Blinn/Phong material mapping in stock Torque 3D. Allows
the developer to control specular and detail. Enhances visual quality
overall.-RK

data.title: ScatterSky Fixes and Improvements
data.body:
Added changes that fix errors associated with Sun Size and ScatterSky
color when using the Time of Day object. Additionally, added the ability
to colorize ScatterSky. Additional fixes apply to correcting Fogging
errors (these fixes work with both ScatterSky and Skybox objects.)

data.body: Updates the squish library from 1.09 to 1.11

data.title: Imposter poles do not work
data.body: When you generate imposter billboard level of detail and check "include poles", poles get generated but do not work in game.

data.title: Engine API fixes
data.body: Fix engine API copy/paste errors (typo).

data.title: Patches the libvorbis update with missed files.
data.body: Somehow these files were missed when staging the libvorbis update commit.

data.title: Updates libogg to v1.3.0
data.body: Updating libogg to version 1.3.0

data.title: Update libvorbis
data.body: Updates libvorbis to v1.3.3

data.title: Compile Bullet library under Windows
data.body:
For some reason the Bullet physics library's project file was not being
included in the solution when the bullet module was added.  This change
makes sure that when you want to use Bullet, it will correctly be added
by the Project Generator.

data.title: Change ShapeBase to only test if available meshes
data.body:
The ShapeBase class tests if all of its meshes are hidden and if so,
then it doesn't render during that frame.  However, if there are no
meshes in the ShapeBase and only nodes then rendering is also skipped.
Unfortunately, this also skips the rendering of any mounted images.
This change allows for a mesh-less skeleton to render any mounted
images.

data.title: Added configuration files for generation VS2012 solutions
data.body: Added configuration files for generating VS2012 solutions for Full, Empty, Full PhysX and Empty PhysX. By default platform toolkit is set to "Visual Studio 2012 - Windows XP (v110_xp)". Maybe others need VS2012 Update 1, but it shouldn't be problem to set that by default to "Visual Studio 2012 (v110)" if needed. Safe Exception Handlers is set by default on NO (/SAFESEH:NO) and hardcored DXSDK library files is replaced with props files for both x86 and x86_64 configuration on VS2012 solution files.

data.title: Razer Hydra integration
data.body:
Adds Razer Hydra input device support to Torque 3D.  To make use of it you will need to include the new _razerHydra_ module in your project (and define its path to the Sixense SDK) and regenerate your project.

Supports individual input events for all Razer Hydra controller functions including absolute position and rotation of each controller.  Also supports a whole frame event that provides access to all values at once.

data.title: Editor crashes when painting a forest in the scene in debug mode physx on stock T3D

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
Build: T3D MIT [Feb 09, 2013] 
Platform: Windows 7 64 bit
Target: Editors

Issues: Editor crashes when painting a forest in the scene in debug mode physx on stock T3D

Steps to Repeat:
1. Compile the above version of T3D MIT in debug mode (used binary project manager to generate project T3DProjectManager-2012-11-21.zip)
2. Launch debug from visual studio
3. Load a template mission, then create a new mission
4. Goto the Physics menu and activate physics
5. Goto the Editors menu and enter the Forest Editor
6. Use the forest brush on the scene, confirm to create a new forest
7. Paint a forest
8. Receive crash: 'File: d:\sw\physx\PhysXSDK\2.8.4\trunk\SDKs\Physics\src\NpPhysicsSDK.cpp Line: 718 PhysicsSDK::releaseTriangleMesh: instances of this mesh still exist!'

data.title: Mission save forest problem
data.body:
I am finding that many times during the save process T3D is crashing resulting in a 0kb forest file - this is usually after very large changes to the forest and is a real pain in the neck

If it fails can it not at least revert to its old version instead of completely wiping out the entire levels forest
